00020 #ifndef XBee_h

00026 #define SERIES_1
00027 #define SERIES_2
00028 
00029 // set to ATAP value of XBee. AP=2 is recommended
00030 #define ATAP 2
00031 
00032 #define START_BYTE 0x7e
00033 #define ESCAPE 0x7d
00034 #define XON 0x11
00035 #define XOFF 0x13
00036 
00037 // This value determines the size of the byte array for receiving RX packets
00038 // Most users won't be dealing with packets this large so you can adjust this
00039 // value to reduce memory consumption. But, remember that
00040 // if a RX packet exceeds this size, it cannot be parsed!
00041 
00042 // This value is determined by the largest packet size (100 byte payload + 64-bit address + option byte and rssi byte) of a series 1 radio
00043 #define MAX_FRAME_DATA_SIZE 110
00044 
00045 #define BROADCAST_ADDRESS 0xffff
00046 #define ZB_BROADCAST_ADDRESS 0xfffe
00047 
00048 // the non-variable length of the frame data (not including frame id or api id or variable data size (e.g. payload, at command set value)
00049 #define ZB_TX_API_LENGTH 12
00050 #define TX_16_API_LENGTH 3
00051 #define TX_64_API_LENGTH 9
00052 #define AT_COMMAND_API_LENGTH 2
00053 #define REMOTE_AT_COMMAND_API_LENGTH 13
00054 // start/length(2)/api/frameid/checksum bytes
00055 #define PACKET_OVERHEAD_LENGTH 6
00056 // api is always the third byte in packet
00057 #define API_ID_INDEX 3
00058 
00059 // frame position of rssi byte
00060 #define RX_16_RSSI_OFFSET 2
00061 #define RX_64_RSSI_OFFSET 8
00062 
00063 #define DEFAULT_FRAME_ID 1
00064 #define NO_RESPONSE_FRAME_ID 0
00065 
00066 // TODO put in tx16 class
00067 #define ACK_OPTION 0
00068 #define DISABLE_ACK_OPTION 1
00069 #define BROADCAST_OPTION 4
00070 
00071 // RX options
00072 #define ZB_PACKET_ACKNOWLEDGED 0x01
00073 #define ZB_BROADCAST_PACKET 0x02
00074 
00075 // not everything is implemented!
00079 #define TX_64_REQUEST 0x0
00080 #define TX_16_REQUEST 0x1
00081 #define AT_COMMAND_REQUEST 0x08
00082 #define AT_COMMAND_QUEUE_REQUEST 0x09
00083 #define REMOTE_AT_REQUEST 0x17
00084 #define ZB_TX_REQUEST 0x10
00085 #define ZB_EXPLICIT_TX_REQUEST 0x11
00086 #define RX_64_RESPONSE 0x80
00087 #define RX_16_RESPONSE 0x81
00088 #define RX_64_IO_RESPONSE 0x82
00089 #define RX_16_IO_RESPONSE 0x83
00090 #define AT_RESPONSE 0x88
00091 #define TX_STATUS_RESPONSE 0x89
00092 #define MODEM_STATUS_RESPONSE 0x8a
00093 #define ZB_RX_RESPONSE 0x90
00094 #define ZB_EXPLICIT_RX_RESPONSE 0x91
00095 #define ZB_TX_STATUS_RESPONSE 0x8b
00096 #define ZB_IO_SAMPLE_RESPONSE 0x92
00097 #define ZB_IO_NODE_IDENTIFIER_RESPONSE 0x95
00098 #define AT_COMMAND_RESPONSE 0x88
00099 #define REMOTE_AT_COMMAND_RESPONSE 0x97
00100 
00101 
00105 #define     SUCCESS 0x0
00106 #define CCA_FAILURE 0x2
00107 #define INVALID_DESTINATION_ENDPOINT_SUCCESS 0x15
00108 #define     NETWORK_ACK_FAILURE 0x21
00109 #define NOT_JOINED_TO_NETWORK 0x22
00110 #define     SELF_ADDRESSED 0x23
00111 #define ADDRESS_NOT_FOUND 0x24
00112 #define ROUTE_NOT_FOUND 0x25
00113 #define PAYLOAD_TOO_LARGE 0x74

00115 // modem status
00116 #define HARDWARE_RESET 0
00117 #define WATCHDOG_TIMER_RESET 1
00118 #define ASSOCIATED 2
00119 #define DISASSOCIATED 3
00120 #define SYNCHRONIZATION_LOST 4
00121 #define COORDINATOR_REALIGNMENT 5
00122 #define COORDINATOR_STARTED 6
00123 
00124 #define ZB_BROADCAST_RADIUS_MAX_HOPS 0
00125 
00126 #define ZB_TX_UNICAST 0
00127 #define ZB_TX_BROADCAST 8
00128 
00129 #define AT_OK 0
00130 #define AT_ERROR  1
00131 #define AT_INVALID_COMMAND 2
00132 #define AT_INVALID_PARAMETER 3
00133 #define AT_NO_RESPONSE 4
00134 
00135 #define NO_ERROR 0
00136 #define CHECKSUM_FAILURE 1
00137 #define PACKET_EXCEEDS_BYTE_ARRAY_LENGTH 2
00138 #define UNEXPECTED_START_BYTE 3

00257       bool isAvailable();

00599 class XBeeRequest {
00600 public:
00605       XBeeRequest(uint8_t apiId, uint8_t frameId);
00609       void setFrameId(uint8_t frameId);
00613       uint8_t getFrameId();
00617       uint8_t getApiId();
00618       // setting = 0 makes this a pure virtual function, meaning the subclass must implement, like abstract in java
00625       virtual uint8_t getFrameData(uint8_t pos) = 0;
00629       virtual uint8_t getFrameDataLength() = 0;
00630       //void reset();
00631 protected:
00632       void setApiId(uint8_t apiId);
00633 private:
00634       uint8_t _apiId;
00635       uint8_t _frameId;
00636 };

00638 // TODO add reset/clear method since responses are often reused
00660 class XBee {
00661 public:
00662       XBee();
00663       // for eclipse dev only
00664       void setSerial(HardwareSerial serial);
00677       void readPacket();
00682       bool readPacket(int timeout);
00688       void readPacketUntilAvailable();
00692       void begin(long baud);
00693       void getResponse(XBeeResponse &response);
00698       XBeeResponse& getResponse();
00702       void send(XBeeRequest &request);
00703       //uint8_t sendAndWaitForResponse(XBeeRequest &request, int timeout);
00707       uint8_t getNextFrameId();
00708 private:
00709       void sendByte(uint8_t b, bool escape);
00710       void resetResponse();
00711       XBeeResponse _response;
00712       bool _escape;
00713       // current packet position for response.  just a state variable for packet parsing and has no relevance for the response otherwise
00714       uint8_t _pos;
00715       // last byte read
00716       uint8_t b;
00717       uint8_t _checksumTotal;
00718       uint8_t _nextFrameId;
00719       // buffer for incoming RX packets.  holds only the api specific frame data, starting after the api id byte and prior to checksum
00720       uint8_t _responseFrameData[MAX_FRAME_DATA_SIZE];
00721 };
